snippet: The militants had pressed the United States to provide several million dollars for the release of James Foley, an American journalist killed in retaliation for recent airstrikes in Iraq.
abstract: Militants of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria pressed United States for multimillion-dollar ransom before killing American journalist James Foley in retaliation for US airstrikes in Iraq; are threatening to execute more Americans in their custody if their demands are not met; Obama administration, sensitive to growing criticism that it had not done enough, reveals that US Special Operations team tried and failed to rescue Foley during secret mission.

byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago, Michael D. Shear from Edgartown, Mass., and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The militants had pressed the United States to provide several million dollars for the release of James Foley, an American journalist killed in retaliation for recent airstrikes in Iraq.

headline.main: Before Killing James Foley, ISIS Demanded Ransom From U.S.
headline.print_headline: ISIS Pressed for Ransom Before Killing Journalist

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
